awd_titl_txt: Postdoctoral Research Fellowship in Plant Biology
awd_abstract_narration: This award funds a postdoctoral research fellowship in plant                    biology for two years.  The project entitled "Mechanisms of                     action of homeotic gene products during floral development                      through chimeric plants" is to be carried out in the laboratory                 of Dr. Elliot Meyerowitz at California Institutes of Technology.                The applicant received his Ph.D. training in the area of cell                   biology with a focus on the protein import into chloroplasts.  In               his postdoctoral training, he plans to study the molecular                      biology of flower development using a variety of mutants of                     Arabidopsis.                                                                                                                                                    The Postdoctoral Fellowships in Plant Biology are designed to                   increase the number of outstanding young investigators in plant                 biology.
